docs.title: Guide to Using Confluence 📘
docs.text:
Welcome to this beginner-friendly guide designed to help you understand and use Confluence effectively in a real-world work environment.

Confluence is widely used by teams to create, organize, and collaborate on documentation such as project notes, meeting minutes, technical guides, and internal knowledge bases.

docs.title: 🔍 What is Confluence?
docs.text:
Confluence is a collaboration and documentation platform developed by Atlassian. It helps teams create, share, and organize knowledge in one central place.

Teams use Confluence to: - Create project documentation - Share meeting notes - Maintain internal knowledge bases - Collaborate in real time

docs.title: 🎯 Who Is This Guide For?
docs.text: This guide is ideal for: - Beginners who are new to Confluence - Freshers joining teams that use Confluence - Professionals who want a simple and clear overview - Anyone interested in learning documentation best practices

docs.title: 📚 What You’ll Learn
docs.text: In this documentation, you’ll learn: - How to get started with Confluence - How pages work and how to manage them - How spaces help organize content - Best practices for documentation - Common questions and answers

docs.title: 🧭 How This Guide Is Organized
docs.text: Use the navigation menu to explore: - Getting Started – Introduction and basics - Pages – Creating and managing content - Spaces – Organizing documentation - FAQ – Common questions and tips

docs.title: 🚀 About This Project
docs.text: This documentation website was created as Portfolio Project #1 to demonstrate: - Technical documentation skills - Clear information structure - Static site generation using MkDocs - Deployment using GitHub Pages

docs.title: FAQ
docs.text:
Q: Is Confluence free? A: Yes, for small teams.

Q: Can I export pages? A: Yes, as PDF or Word.

docs.title: Understanding Spaces
docs.text: Spaces help organize documentation by team or project.
